New Records: Shadab Khan hit the second-fastest fifty by a Pakistan batter in T20I cricket -- 50 off just 20 balls
Key Match Events: South Africa were 16 runs behind the DLS par score at the end of the 9th over
Shadab Khan turned things around in the 8th over with two wickets of the two set batters
Temba Bavuma showed signs of return to form with a stunning 36 from 19 balls
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain fell even during the closing stages of the Pakistan innings but the umpires decided to carry on and complete the 20 overs as its intensity was not high
South Africa have already been impacted by rain in the tournament as wet weather robbed them of 2 points in their Super 12 match against Zimbabwe in Hobart on October 24
Others: Pakistan posted 185 on the board in 20 overs on a slippery day in Sydney even after losing captain Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan early
South Africa lost opener Quinton de Kock (0) and Rilee Rossouw (7) after a wonderful new-ball spell from Shaheen Afridi
